content.c_venueAddress: 268-269 Tottenham Court Rd, Fitzrovia, London W1T 7AQ
content.name: Sister Act The Musical

primaryPhoto.description:
Brace yourselves Sisters! The eagerly anticipated Broadway and UK smash-hit musical SISTER ACT THE MUSICAL is coming back to the Dominion Theatre in London’s West End in 2024!
All your prayers have been answered with a stunning cast, including  multi-award-winning music star and Olivier Award-winning performer Beverley Knight and X Factor winner and international pop icon Alexandra Burke, both portraying the role of disco diva-in-disguise Deloris Van Cartier on different dates through the run*.
Ruth Jones** (star of Gavin and Stacey) will join the Sisterhood as Mother Superior from 15 March – 8 June. Reprising their previous roles are television and stage star Lesley Joseph, Hackney royalty and Olivier Award-winner Clive Rowe***, and rising star Lizzie Bea. Completing the congregation are BRIT Award-winning singer songwriter Lemar****, Britain’s Got Talent and musical theatre star Alison Jiear and beloved star of La Cage aux Folles at Regent’s Park Carl Mullaney.
This sparkling tribute to the universal power of friendship, sisterhood and music. Featuring a marvellous Motown-inspired score by Tony® and 8-time Oscar® winner Alan Menken (Disney’s Aladdin, Enchanted), dazzling dance routines and songs inspired by Motown, soul and disco, this this story of music, mishaps and nuns on the run is a joyous and uplifting tale of finding your voice and singing out, with your sisters by your side is a show you will never forget.
After delighting half a million people in London and on tour across the country, the nuns are back in the habit and ready to rock the pews from March 2024 – don’t miss it!
Book your SISTER ACT THE MUSICAL theatre tickets with LOVEtheatre today!
*Beverley Knight will play Deloris from 15 March to 8 June 2024. Alexandra Burke will play Deloris from 10 June to 31 August 2024
**Ruth Jones will not be performing from 9 May to 13 May 2024
***Clive Rowe will not be performing from 3 June to 8 June 2024
****Lemar will not be performing from 5 April to 17 April, and 27 April.
